overview: An integrated approach to research in the field of educational and developmental psychology. The interdependence of research theory and methods is emphasised. Practical aspects of data management and analysis (using SPSS or other software) are included in the laboratory component. Specific research techniques are studied, including their selection, use, interpretation, and reporting. Datasets relevant to the practice of educational psychology are used in exercises where students practice statistical and qualitative data analysis and interpretation.
ilo: Evaluate research literature in educational psychology and draw conclusions about satisfactory evidence-based approaches to psychological issues.
Competently select and use appropriate data analysis techniques to address specific research questions.
Plan an independent enquiry in psychology and education.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.hurdle: Attendance at a minimum of 80% of all classes

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours plus 96 hours of non-contact commitment time
